title: Robokiller: Spam Call Blocker
content:
I downloaded RoboKiller with the impression that I would be notified before the free trial ended, giving me the chance to decide whether or not to continue. That promise was never honored‚Äîwithout a single alert, I was charged $130.

The most frustrating part is that the app itself barely functions as advertised. Numerous spam and junk calls still slipped through without being filtered, making the subscription essentially worthless. What makes matters worse is that the app‚Äôs effectiveness seems to depend heavily on your iOS version and carrier, creating an inconsistent and unreliable experience.

I reached out for support and have received no response whatsoever, which only underscores how little accountability this company shows its customers. At best, this app is ineffective. At worst, it feels like a deliberate scam‚Äîcharging a premium fee while delivering a subpar product and ignoring customer concerns.

If you value your money and peace of mind, I strongly urge you to avoid this app.

title: Robokiller: Spam Call Blocker
content:
09/2025 UPDATE: As of Sept 2025 app has pushed out many updates, but app still crashes constantly and does not work as advertised. As a multi-year customer who remembers how app used to work this is very troubling. I basically paid $80 for a useless program. All I can say is BUYER BEWARE, don‚Äôt waste your money, and learn from my mistake. 

I‚Äôve been a subscriber for 4 years, unfortunately this app no longer works (and is WAY OVERPRICED) Ever since app updated 2 weeks ago (right after price increase) the app has decided to stop working. I have an older iPhone on iOS 15.8.3 so app should work. I‚Äôve deleted app, rebooted to flush cache / memory and re-installed app as per their instructions ‚Ä¶ which fixed nothing. I also ‚Äúsubmitted a bug‚Äù per their website and all I‚Äôve gotten back is a generic email reply thanking me for reaching out. No ticket# re: bug, nothing. So I was basically charged 79.99 for an app that no longer works. YMMV, but I would highly recommend looking elsewhere atm. UPDATE, as of 01-13-2024 RoboKiller rolled out yet another update last week [Version 24.7.16] and application still does not work. After clean install app just hangs & then crashes while trying to load. As of now, I‚Äôve still paid 79.99 and no longer have access to apps features/services.

title: Glo | Yoga and Meditation App
content: I used an offer I was sent for a yearly membership. At no point did I sign up to be automatically renewed for this. I got spammed so much by glow that the email started to go to my spam folder. Then, while I am transitioning job out of town for my first job in this new role, I was charged for a yearly subscription. This amount was way more original amount I paid and it was something that I never consented to. I then came home, found the email in my spam that they had said that they had sent me to. It didn‚Äôt ask me if I wanted it renewed, it just told me that it would. I find this unacceptable. And let their customer service have the opportunity to make this right with me. While I do not want the service right now., I do recommend it often to my clients. Moving forward, I will not be recommending a platform that takes money that people don‚Äôt have when they don‚Äôt consent to it. Then, when given the opportunity to make it right, they do not take it. They would rather lose a client, then refund the money so that my life can be easier and I can still pay my rent coming up.

This app is performing worse and worse as time goes by.  Google Keep is a fundamental part of my life, so this app needs to be working.

2. When typing, it often hides the keyboard mid typing. Something about the app is causing the keyboard to minimize, and this also interferes.

3. Basic things like indenting checklist.  I just had a hilarious battle where I tried to indent a sub entry on a checklist, and over and over again it un-indented the same entry. 

I‚Äôm worried you guys don‚Äôt care about this app any more, but my data is locked up.  If you want to discontinue it, fine, but give me instructions to offload my data and a suggested replacement.  Or integrate it with one of the products you do care about.

author: CJ95Eagles

title: Google Keep - Notes and lists
content:
It‚Äôs great to have it sync with family and Google Home.

But my primary use case is shared lists, and Keep has horrible accessibility.

On iOS, there is a three second timeout after which keyboard focus leaves a list item, finalizing the list item with whatever text was input. If you are a slow typer or use alternate input means - or even if you just need a few seconds to form your thoughts - google keep interrupts you.

You end up with empty list items because you didn‚Äôt type fast enough. You end up making multiple list items instead of one. You end up cut off with half written list items.

Unless you are a fast typer who always has fully formed thoughts ready to input without pause, this app is nearly unusable.

This no doubt demonstrates the limitations of a formulaic user testing process. I have a hunch that the Keep QA team has list entry items ready to go, and quickly runs through tests, rather than testing real world use cases - especially with a variety of accessibility considerations.

author: shadows+dust

title: Roadblock - Content Blocker
content:
My first app review ever!  

Wow!  I am so happy and relieved. I found a way to block internet stories about Trump!  Like him or hate him...there is just too much about him every day!  It was overwhelming. 

I downloaded Roadblock because it also allows ‚Äúcustom settings‚Äù.  After one email exchange with the developer, in the custom settings I wrote ‚ÄúTrump‚Äù, and now 90% of the stories never show on my browser and the 10% that slip through don‚Äôt allow me to click through to the article!!!  

The developer wrote that the app ‚Äúcurrently only allows filtering based on things that match in the URL. For example, you can block URLs if "trump" appears anywhere in the URL.‚Äù  That is why I got a 90% success rate instead of 100%. 

The developer then wrote: ‚ÄúWe will add the ability to hide content based on matching things in URLs in the next update.‚Äù  

For my purposes, the 90% Reduction in Trump stories is amazing for my internet experience.  Then, with the blocking of ‚Äúadvertising‚Äù, I am thrilled with this app. 

Well worth the $1.99. 

I have an amazing feeling of freedom today!!!

title: MindDoc: Mental Health Support
content: I‚Äôm a 17yo girl and I‚Äôve been through hell and back with my depression. MindDoc has genuinely helped me to realize what I need to focus on, if I‚Äôm going through an episode, and helps my therapist and I see how I‚Äôve been feeling. I never use an app like this for longer than 2 weeks because I normally get tired of them but it‚Äôs been almost 9 months of me using this app and it‚Äôs helped so much. I started using it this year right before the pandemic because I had just gone through a heart break and was on the edge of ending it all. I found MindDoc and have used it every single day since. I‚Äôm very grateful for the help and guidance this app has given me. I would recommend this app to everyone, even if you don‚Äôt have a mental illness.

author: Cam2142155

title: Today Habit tracker
content:
There is a lot to love about this app but it is missing a few key functions that make habit tracking more successful. In addition to ‚Äúcheck ins‚Äù (positive score) there ought to be a way to record ‚Äúmissed check -ins‚Äù (negative score) and just also a way to log days where you missed your habit but it was intentional (neutral/no penalty score). The metrics of only seeing your number of check ins is a useless metric without also seeing those days you dropped the ball. 

It‚Äôs also be great to see two habits side by side so you can see if your ‚Äúearly to bed‚Äù habit has a correlation to ‚Äúdeep work‚Äù the following day‚Äîanother reason why showing ‚Äúmissed‚Äù days would be useful. 

I like how you can schedule a habit that has a once/week (or whatever) frequency but I‚Äôd love to see a countdown on that habit so you know, ‚Äú3 more days left in week to accomplish habit‚Äù

The ability to add in widgets is amazing! Design is beautiful ... Just wish some of the basic habit-tracking functionality was more useful.

title: Today Habit tracker
content:
As long as you keep your phone with you, you will never forget an important task again. With the app you can set daily or weekly reminders that will notify you to do any chore at anytime of the day, and if you need to complete a task several times a day you can set it up to remind you multiple times a day. The app has beautiful backgrounds and a lovely font. Among other things, I use the app to make sure I drink enough water and stretch at particular times during the day, and water my plants when they need to be watered, since my memory isn‚Äôt what it used to be. The app is easy to use! And there is an easy to understand video tutorial that comes with it. Apparently, there are other things the app can do, but I haven‚Äôt gotten around to exploring them yet. Use the basic version for free or pay a small fee once for the upgrade. The app will back up your data in case you need to reinstall it, but this feature is probably only available with the upgrade. It was recommended by a teacher, and I am glad I tried it. Now it‚Äôs an essential part of my life.

Edit:
Although I enjoy the app, I learned that it breaks often and needs to be reinstalled frequently to get the reminders working again. I still use it to log events, but became tired of reinstalling it and resetting up the reminders, so they haven‚Äôt worked for at least a year.

author: chi tr·∫ßn 200823

title: Alarm & Timer
content:
Apple's default clock app and the way their alarms work has annoyed me since its inception. I have ADHD and I really struggle with time blindness, so I use alarms on my phone set every ten minutes to keep myself on time when getting ready for work in the morning to remind me of how much time has passed and prompt me to move on to the next task, when to leave the house, etc. Apple's clock app has always been so clunky and inconvenient to use in the ways I need to use it. This app allows the perfect customization I need and works even better than I expected!! 

features I especially love about this app:

- you can put alarms in folders and turn all alarms in those folders on/off at once without effecting any of your other alarms!

- you can turn on a feature that displays ONE button to turn on/off ALL alarms at once without having to go in and click each one on/off individually!

- once you create one alarm, it remembers those settings when creating your next series of alarms so you don't have to tediously set the same settings over and over!

- there is a button on each alarm that allows you to skip that alarm for just the next time it is set to go off! which is perfect for my ADHD brain, which is prone to forgetting to turn that alarm back on again if I had to turn it off just for one day.

- you can create a schedule and set alarms to go off at a specific date and time! great for reminding me about bills and such each month.

- when the alarm goes off, a banner notification appears that actually reads the time! I watch YouTube when getting ready for work, and this is so helpful to tell me the time without exiting the YT app. Apple's just says "Alarm Clock" without the time, it's so annoying. 

- there is a setting you can turn on that sends a notification every time you leave the app to make sure you turn off silent mode so you don't accidentally not hear your alarms, which is great for my forgetful ADHD brain. (alarms don't sound on silent mode)

Stuff I wish the app had (but is not a necessity for it to still be great):

- It would be cool if when the alarm goes off, there was an option to have the time read aloud.
author: kjhagen94

title: Alarm & Timer

If I‚Äôm in a different app on my phone the alarm doesn‚Äôt go off‚Ä¶.. only if in locked mode does it work. And even then-  it doesn‚Äôt always go off. I had 2 alarms set within 10 minutes of each other (precautionary) - no headphones were plugged in-   to grab a shower before an early flight, my alarms never went off - either one of them. I woke to my friend‚Äôs alarm much later. I‚Äôve deleted the app.

title: Shield Porn Blocker
content: This app has been a lifesaver in helping me overcome porn addiction, along with ditching social media and other apps that might be a source for explicit content (These other steps are necessary for this app to be effective). However, I would argue this is necessary to eliminate as many avenues as possible for accessing porn. There are still explicit sites out there that the app hasn‚Äôt caught (most of which aren‚Äôt explicitly porn sites but have pornographic content), so to help all benefiting from this app, please let the developer know if you find any of these that should be blocked.

title: Do Habits: Get It Done
content:
This week I installed quite a few habit trackers and was disappointed in either the price or unnecessary complexity, or lack of fundamental features. For me this app hits the sweet spot.

I hesitated purchasing the premium lifetime for $19.99 based on all of the one star recent reviews. I am unsure what is causing the subscription problem for these users and the lack of tech-support involved is disheartening however, wanted to add a review stating I was successful at purchasing and using a lifetime premium upgrade. 

As someone who has published an app on the Apple App Store, this series of one star reviews may permanently damage the future of this app. So far, I am very happy with this habit tracker so I hope things get worked out. 

The developer should update this apps store description to address the recent slew of subscription problems.

author: tkane2000

title: Brain.fm: Focus & Sleep Music
content:
I‚Äôm 23 weeks in using this app and it is my most important tool. I came to brain.fm for the variety and I stayed because I found I can actually focus. 

I‚Äôve tried several things to calm my monkey mind and give it something to occupy itself with while I work, read or plan. I‚Äôve had a waterfall on my desk physically and monitor virtually , I‚Äôve listened to classical music (thank you Mozart), I‚Äôve listened to white noise, tried brown noise, and I even bought an album with nothing but the sounds of a coffee shop (a favorite by the way) I‚Äôve listened to more audiobooks than I can count(for the more repetitive tasks).  I‚Äôve even tried working on my computer in VR to shut out distractions (how much battery do I have left?)

I tried brain.fm because the coffee shop was getting old but I‚Äôve found that (coupled with noise canceling headphones or even regular earbuds), I can sit at the kitchen table in the middle of life happening and still focus on what I‚Äôm doing.  Where my wife walking by used to throw me off, now I barely notice.  It‚Äôs almost like VR. I‚Äôve also been attacking my distractibility from other angles but, I was using brain.fm before that. 

As I‚Äôve used it I gradually added in or took away certain sounds. I‚Äôve liked what I liked and thumb downed what I didn‚Äôt (the evil drone didn‚Äôt work for me) I‚Äôve done the meditation, I tried sleep but it pulled a Pink Floyd Dark Side of the Moon and scared me awake after lulling me off, easily fixable with a thumb down. 

Thank you guys for a great app and the work you‚Äôve put into it. If the science is just a scam don‚Äôt tell me about it because it‚Äôs been working great for me.  I suspect there has to be something to the science though because every now and then I stop and realize ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been working on this for 2 hours?‚Äù

author: ZZ3000

title: Brain.fm: Focus & Sleep Music
content:
I have ADHD and suffer from severe difficulty focusing on a frequent basis. I‚Äôm also musically inclined so listening to normal music in the background is usually more distracting than helpful. I had heard trusted influencers recommend Brain.fm but I was skeptical at first because I already pay for music subscriptions and macOS and iOS come with native sounds of nature you can play on repeat so it seemed like I should be able to get by without spending more money, especially when it‚Äôs a significant amount. I tried looking up the research to see if it was legit studies proving the music actually helps someone focus and my attempts were inconclusive.

Nevertheless, I tried the trial and noticed an immediate difference in my ability to focus. The music is not distracting but just fades into the background. I was also afraid it wouldn‚Äôt have enough diversity of music or genres to choose from but they actually have a ton of diversity and are continuously coming out with new tracks. I try new stuff all the time and haven‚Äôt yet heard it all. I also expanded to the other types of music, for meditation and for sleeping, when needed. Sometimes I get a little craving for real music in the background but I still want the cognitive effects of brain.fm so I will layer it by playing it from the brain.fm website a little softer volume than my Apple Music while I‚Äôm working and this works well.

There of course is no magic bullet for ADHD but I have been using it for 30 straight weeks now and I believe it is an indispensable tool in my arsenal for treating ADHD without medication.

author: DBT Queen

title: Habitify: Habit Tracker
content: I've been a daily user for a year or so. It is a great way to plan a day and being able to focus by allowing me to only show what I need to do by time of day, which keeps me from feeling overwhelmed with all I want to do. The automatic health data entry is critical for healthy habits since it reduces the friction of adopting the habit, and instead makes the feature more about accountability. I'm not sure what I would change if I could change anything, sometimes there's syncing bugs, and I wish the app would not send a reminder notification to do a habit that I've already completed earlier in the day. Maybe walkthroughs, insights, and suggestions how I should interpret and make changes from the progress reports. Atoms from the guy who wrote Atomic Habits recently added a new app that introduced some things that I like about it, such as encouragement to never miss twice, reflecting on the habit, interaction flow decisions at habit creation that teach how to define good habits and make them stick.

author: Chris Sullivan 55

title: Aura: Meditation & Sleep, CBT
content:
I‚Äôve been using the Aura Health App for the past year, and it has been an absolute game-changer for my mental well-being. This app offers so much more than just meditation‚Äîit provides a complete toolkit for mindfulness, emotional healing, and self-care.

One of the best features is the live 90-minute sessions with amazing coaches who provide real guidance and support. The variety of content‚Äîmeditations, life coaching, sleep stories, and breathwork‚Äîensures there‚Äôs always something to fit my needs, whether I‚Äôm looking for relaxation, motivation, or a way to manage stress.

Aura also offers one-on-one coaching sessions for an extra fee, which is a fantastic option for those who want personalized support. The ability to work directly with experienced coaches makes this app stand out even more.

I also love how Aura personalizes recommendations based on my mood and preferences, making each experience feel tailored just for me. The quality of the content and the expertise of the coaches make this app worth every penny.

If you‚Äôre looking for a meditation and wellness app that truly supports your mental health journey, Aura is the one to get! Highly recommend it to anyone seeking more peace, balance, and clarity in their life.

It‚Äôs so refreshing to just go to a calming, non distracting FREE app and just study while an Apple tree or a huggable cactus just sits there
Thank you so much! Studying is definitely better when you get some dopamine from virtual coins :))
Speaking of, will there be any more updates on new plants? I bought them all and I‚Äôm rigorously saving up for the next one üíö

author: any. cabrera

title: Plantie - Stay focused
content: ...this works! Like many others right now, I've been working from home since the COVID-19 quarantine became mandatory, and I have been having AWFUL issues focusing. My productivity went down by maybe 30 percent, and I was worried it might become a permanent issue. But not with this! My eight hour workdays are now totally bearable, and I can now schedule 50-55 minutes of focus time with 5-10 minute breaks at the end of the hour. My productivity returned to office-level heights. The app is pretty, functional AND fully-fledged all while remaining completely free. The other productivity timers either require a purchase or have limited capabilities‚Äîdon't waste your time. Stick with this.

title: Timer & stopwatch - Timeglass
content:
UPDATE:  still love it!  Uses: Tabata/HIIT, students, widget on Home Screen. 

ORIGINAL:
Using for multiple students in different programs all at once. I set a timer for each of them; some timers repeat so the student can learn how to break up thirty minutes during a test.  The voice speaks their name and time left as each timer ticks down. It keeps me on top of each student's time.

Also using it for my stretching; created a 10 step timer easily copying the first step, so I don't have to keep count.

The alarm choices are nice (length choices, too) and I can choose an icon from so many options.

The widget makes it all easy to control when using it. 

Love it!

title: Daylio Journal - Daily Diary
content: Daylio reinvents journaling for the time-strapped, offering a minimalist interface to log moods and activities with quick taps and customizable icons. Its strength lies in simplicity‚Äîno typing required‚Äîmaking daily entries effortless and consistent. The app excels at visualizing mood trends and habit patterns over weeks or months, ideal for mental health awareness or routine tracking. Free features are generous, but the premium upgrade unlocks deeper insights (goals, unlimited activities) and removes ads, though the one-time purchase option is a welcome reprieve from subscription fatigue. However, the lack of text-based prompts or rich formatting limits its appeal for reflective writers, and repetitive logging can feel robotic over time. Occasional syncing hiccups and a clunky backup system also nag. Perfect for **casual users seeking a low-effort mood diary**, but those craving narrative depth may pair it with traditional journaling apps. A polished, accessible tool that prioritizes convenience over complexity.

author: JustAnotherMeg

title: Fabulous: Daily Habit Tracker
content:
I have been using this app for a few weeks, and I plan to use it for the next few months to incorporate some healthier habits in to my day. I have been going through a fertility journey that has caused depression and a feeling of being stuck and lost. I used to be very disciplined, so I am hoping this app will help me get back on track and I can honestly say that it already has in a short amount of time. 

Some of the things I love: the app will choose simple habits for you (like drink water first thing in the morning, stretch for 1 minute every day). When you‚Äôre depressed, it can be hard to think of and create these goals for yourself, so I love that they choose them for you. I also love the daily coaching and how they seamlessly integrate it in to your routine. The lessons are helpful and I have learned a lot about my behaviors. 

Some of the things I don‚Äôt love: there is A LOT going on in this app. The first time I opened it, I immediately thought to myself, ‚Äúthere is no way I will be using this for more than a day‚Äù because it was wildly overwhelming and confusing. I decided to push through, and I have a general idea of where things are now, but I still don‚Äôt understand the flow of the app. This needs a lot of work. There is also a ton of advertising for there other apps, which needs to be toned down.

Overall, I do think this app is helpful, but it needs to be decluttered and the flow needs to be improved.

author: Tonylizzy

title: Fabulous: Daily Habit Tracker
content:
Setting up the account for this walked me through steps which prompted me to start with paying minimum $1 to use the app generally. I selected the $1 option and chose to skip about 5 ‚Äúoffers‚Äù for other apps and declined what I thought was premium. The app then welcomed me to premium, and when I went to my account settings I was subscribed to pay over $20 a month. After I cancelled the subscription immediately, I checked the invoice link through settings which shows a $30+ purchase, with the plan scheduled to cancel at the end of the month. Overall extremely confusing interface. I‚Äôm sure the app is helpful to some behaviorally, but I will not be trying it given the risk of spending more than I am aware of. 

This part is just nitpicky, but: the ai generated art used across the platform is tough on the eyes. For example, when setting a goal to drink water, there is a generated image of a man holding a water bottle behind his face, and a blue mouth. Off-putting. 

To the devs: I hope you can reduce the amount of repetitive payment prompts when using the app, as it creates more opportunities for accidental subscription‚Äîyour application is advertised to people who are in a hard place, do not make it worse by adding financial worry. And for the graphics, try some softer color contrasts? Have the art either produced by a graphic designer or make it simple vectors. At the very least, review the ai-generated images before integrating them into the app.

author: haiwpfnsj28475

title: Oak - Meditation & Breathing
content:
I have over a decade of experience meditating but have fell out of practice for a while. So I wanted to try an app to help me get back into having a consistent practice again. I tried some of the other well known apps (that also cost money), and didn‚Äôt like them. I did a search for free meditation apps & Oak was on the list.

I have to say I love this app. It is no frills while also being so well-designed. Oftentimes free apps are hideous & dated, have bad UI, and functionality issues. Not Oak! It‚Äôs minimal design gets out of the way, looks gorgeous, and functions so well. There are no ads either, which is also rare for a free app.

The options for guided & unguided meditation are superior compared to others I‚Äôve seen. The guided meditation instructors give cues while also knowing when to shut up & let you do the actual practice. Can‚Äôt stand it when a guided meditation instructor doesn‚Äôt stop talking - it gets in the way of the practice & becomes distracting rather than helpful. But Oak‚Äôs guided meditations strike a good balance & I really like them. 

The unguided option is great too. I like that they have the option to add or remove chimes at whatever interval you choose (5, 10, 20 mins, etc). It helps keep you focused & also helps if you start wondering how long you have left. And you can set whatever length of time you want for your session - it uses the scrolling time feature that the timer uses on your iPhone. Like if for whatever reason you wanted to do some odd number that‚Äôs not a real interval, like 23 minutes, you could. LoL.

There‚Äôs also guided courses you can take around a specific theme. The one I‚Äôm doing is a 10 day mantra class with each session being about 15-25 minutes. Love it.

title: Oak - Meditation & Breathing
content:
I have been using this app for years after hearing about it on the Tim Ferris show. I‚Äôm a newbie to meditating and have only been doing it consistently for 1.5 years. That said I‚Äôve purchased Ten Percent and recently Waking Up; however I find myself coming back to this app on a daily basis as those apps lack the breathing exercises I love in this app. Why do I love them? They work. They help me fall asleep, lower my BP when I‚Äôm stressing, I measured it - no exaggeration, and it‚Äôs free. I feel guilty not having paid a dime and would gladly make an app purchase or one time donation to show my appreciation.
You have nothing to lose but stress, if you‚Äôre on the fence you shouldn‚Äôt be. Download and thank me later.

title: Microsoft To Do
content:
The app. has a very nice workflow, decent UI, and the integration with Microsoft office is awesome!‚Ä¶but, it crashes every one to three minutes during regular use. I‚Äôm submitting feedback here because it crashed while I was writing feedback within the app. 

The UI also behaves a little oddly while reordering items in a list. For example, if reordering tasks in a list, it‚Äôs very easy to accidentally drop one task on top of another which unintentionally turns it into a sub-task. If reordering steps within a task, it‚Äôs easy to slide your finger too far to the right which will remove the step from the task and promote it to a task. 

Overall good app,  it the constant crashing makes it almost unusable.

title: Google Assistant
content: My home mini used to work great but the last year has been useless. Alarms wake up my entire apartment because it plays so loud that it can‚Äôt hear me ‚ÄúHEY GOOGLE TURN OFF THE ALARM‚Äù(x4-5 before I just unplug it and throw it across the room and effectively choosing violence to start my day). I‚Äôll also add it‚Äôs about 6ft from my head so not only is the volume level ridiculous but it should definitely be able to hear me. I ask it to turn off the lights it dings‚Ä¶ then nothing happens. Even programmed routines are done wrong. She plays sleep sounds when I say ‚Äúgoodnight‚Äù (meant to just turn off all my lights). Just today I‚Äôm watching a class lecture on my tv and she‚Äôs still playing the sleep sounds at 2pm. I‚Äôve started talking to it like a small child, ‚Äúhey Google, turn off the countryside sleep sounds that YOUR playing from YOUR speaker‚Äù, ‚Äúok turning off the tv.‚Äù And there goes the lecture video that I had to set up screenplay for. Like how on earth does that translate. In the words of Kelly Kapoor, ‚Äúif I made a website with this many problems I‚Äôd kill myself.‚Äù It gets things right maybe 10% of the time. Reason to stay vegan for me is counteracting how much this thing has raised my blood pressure. I‚Äôve been using the apps for my lights more and more and might just trash the thing. I could walk around and turn the lights on faster than this thing can figure out what day of the week it is. Also just found out it stopped automating my lights (had it turn everything off when my location wasn‚Äôt home) and have been just pissing away electricity trusting this device. Save your money and your mental health and either see if Alexa is any better or go catch yourself a pet rock.

content:
Used to just use the Notepad app, but this is wayyyy better. Kind of a lot of buttons at times which can seem intimidating but once you learn em it just makes everything so efficient. There‚Äôs some free templates in here too that make it fun to organize everything. 

For example there‚Äôs a ‚ÄúTrack your Habits Template‚Äù and you can add whatever you want, pick a cute lil icon, and when you mark it as ‚Äúdone‚Äù it makes a lil streak flame and lights up green on a calendar. Scratches that itch that a normal bubble-in feature doesn‚Äôt. 

So far I haven‚Äôt found a notifications thing or alarm function but I‚Äôm confident if I actually look I‚Äôll find something

title: Notion: Notes, Tasks, AI
content:
I was locked out of my account without warning due to sanctions, even though I permanently reside outside of jurisdiction and never used an associated payment method. Access was revoked just because I briefly traveled there ‚Äî despite the company‚Äôs own policy stating that access should be restored once outside the restricted region.

I contacted support multiple times, but only received generic, copy-paste replies with no willingness to look into my individual case. This caused major disruption to my work, and I still can‚Äôt even retrieve my data.

If you rely on this product for work or critical information, be cautious ‚Äî there‚Äôs no guarantee you won‚Äôt be suddenly locked out, and support won‚Äôt help.

author: balsimo777

title: HypnoBox: Hypnosis & Sleep
content:
When I first downloaded this app two months ago I gave a 2-star rating. It was very confusing how to use the app. I was in contact after that with the developer who was absolutely wonderful to work with and he helped me maximize the app and understand the power in the ‚Äúbox‚Äù
This is a very innovative way to deliver hypnosis. Their content is very well done as well. I particularly like the voice of the British male, I think his name is Martin Heckman, it‚Äôs just addictive!
My star rating is really more like 4.5. I know they will keep working on the user experience to make it the best 5 star app on the market and in two months I already see some improvements.

I find the proograms very helpful. I initially used the app to prepare me for surgery. It worked really well and I had a very peaceful surgery and recovery. I spent about two weeks with various programs to relieve anxiety, minimize fear and anxiety, and find peace in the decision I had made.
I‚Äôm back on the app now to work on finding motivation to get back to my regular life and relive some post op depression.  Just finished my first session and it reminded me how great this tool box is and I‚Äôm looking forward to more sessions.

Suggestion: create a calendar and reminders so the user schedules in their daily hypnosis.
Another idea would be to create more predefined sessions based on user input on what they‚Äôre looking to work on. 

Cheers!
author: Kstoural

title: HypnoBox: Hypnosis & Sleep
content:
This is my second review. My first was after 3 sessions for weight loss. I still love it so much. And it is working! After the first session I noticed a huge difference in what I ate, and also how I ate slower and noticed everything about what I was eating. 

My challenge is finding a place and time to do a session where my dogs don't interrupt me by barking. I'm working on it. 

I am excited to see more voices in the future. My next session will be self love. 

One last thing, I love that there is drink less alcohol and another on being alcohol free. So smart!

Thank you so much for this app!  Arizona, USA

author: Rthsiung

title: HabitMinder ‚Ä¢ Habit Tracker
content:
This app is exactly what you need. Believe me.
It helps you think the way you should be thinking.
One of the good things about this app is that you can use it in whatever way you see fit.
I will share with you the way I use the app (I might be one of the only ones to use it like this, but it‚Äôs awesome).
One of the problems I‚Äôve always had when trying to take on a new habit was that, once I missed my ‚Äústreak‚Äù, it was hard to get back to it. For instance, let‚Äôs say I start going to the gym, boom, two months in, haven‚Äôt missed a day, you feel AWESOME. But then, the day comes where you just can‚Äôt go, now what? Now you missed your streak, you broke your word, what‚Äôs even the point of going tomorrow, you‚Äôre a failure.
Well, not so fast.
With habit minder, the DEBT is still there, if you had a goal to read 30 pages a day, and the day comes where you can‚Äôt do it, nothing stops you from reading 60 pages the following day. If you want to go to the gym five times a week (monday through friday) and you missed a day, there is nothing stopping you from going on saturday and finishing that workout you were supposed to do on wednesday. I mean, wow.
It is also really visual and it helps you see the habits you are not following through, it helps you see the things you are avoiding, and that is an amazing insight into your personality, it shows what you are running away from. Why are you so scared, go and do it (literally talking to myself rn)!
So yeah, amazing app, like Jordan Peterson says, you will not get where you wanna get by accident, you have to have it written down, and go for it consciously, and at the end of the day, if you WRITE DOWN YOUR GOALS, and you don‚Äôt forget about them (which is what this app ensures), you will be a more successful person in a year, even if you only hit them 50% of the time (A LOT BETTER THAN 0), if you have 70% completion rate, out of 20 habits or so? Wow, you‚Äôre on the right path, and you can always strive for more next month, my current goal is 80% completion rate out of all my 22 habits (currently at 79%), and a 60% minimum in any given habit (which is really hard cause some of them are tough lol).
Oh well, what can I say, thank you guys for developing this amazing tool, and I feel like I‚Äôm stealing from you guys with the 9.99$ a year (like really, are you kidding me guys? why not subscribe??) BEST 10$ INVESTMENT I EVER MADE
BY THE WAY, don‚Äôt listen to the people who are telling you guys to remove the option to change previous days (like yesterday) are you crazy?? that‚Äôs the whole point of the app for me. Pleasee don‚Äôt change that you guys, people like me, who get unmotivated when we lose our ‚Äústreak‚Äù need the ability to go back and get on track, do NOT REMOVE THIS FEATURE!!!!! (people who don‚Äôt like it can just not use it)

content: I was hoping this would be an easy way around YT‚Äôs recent ad-block crack down, as the free ad-blockers I‚Äôd been using have recently stopped consistently working. Unfortunately, after working mostly fine for 2 days, today it is also no longer performing its function, which is the same result I got from the free ad-blockers. So what exactly is worth paying for here? I didn‚Äôt even end up having to use the full 30 days of the free trial, because it stopped working after 2 days.

author: Ry7n_

title: Ad blocker by Magic Lasso
content:
I purchased this app specifically to eliminate YouTube ads; it seemed to do alright initially but for the last 2+ weeks I get an ad mid-video for every video I watch. I have not changed Apple ID. I checked that the app was enabled and up to date (last update was today, actually). I confirmed the app knew I had pro subscription. 

If the app is not going to do what I purchased it for successfully, I am not going to pay for it. I regret having done the year subscription; if you are considering subscribing start with the monthly and see if it works for you.
author: Mjikolp

title: Ad blocker by Magic Lasso
content: A very effective Safari extension that blocks most all ads & trackers without any user input? Yep. Ability to make your own blocking rules as you go? Yep. Tap to block unwanted elements on any webpage? Yep. Several more features to list but you‚Äôll figure them out. Suffice to say it‚Äôs still a little obtuse in some regards. You have to discover some of its features on your own. For instance if you‚Äôre trying to block YouTube ads it won‚Äôt always work. You‚Äôll get YouTube‚Äôs terms of service warning page instead. Unless you pull to refresh the content you want to watch multiple times then it‚Äôll load up without the ads. This little tip isn‚Äôt listed in the apps rules or on the developer website & probably for good reason (though I suppose I‚Äôve let the cat out of the bag now myself if it was meant to be a hush hush pro-tip‚Ä¶ Oops). It doesn‚Äôt always work due to YouTube‚Äôs constant battle trying to circumvent ad blockers. But when it does it‚Äôs magic just like the name implies. Seems a bit expensive at first but it includes family sharing for the price so it‚Äôs really a bargain in my view. Make it so the rules auto update without me having to open the app itself & it‚Äôs a 5 star rating.

content: You can‚Äôt even try the app without paying for it. It‚Äôs fairly useless. If you want to adjust the timer, it‚Äôs on a circular motion with your finger on the screen and you literally cannot get it to stop at 25 minutes if you decide that‚Äôs what you want. 24 minutes and 59 seconds then it‚Äôs back to 00:00. What if you want longer than 25 minutes? The sounds don‚Äôt sound much like they‚Äôre supposed to. The ‚Äúgentle rain‚Äù sounds like a downpour. None of them are sounds I‚Äôd use. No white, brown, or pink noise option. Also, there is ZERO guidance when you open the app. You just have to click around until you figure it out. I can‚Äôt believe I spent $10 on this. author: samariaw

title: Freedom: Screen Time Control
content:
I haven't found other apps that block to the same extent, nor reinforce the schedules as strongly. 

Following a quick story for illustration:

Yesterday, one schedule was active, but I downloaded other apps to get lost. I was so immersed, that I put off socializing, eating, and basic chores. 

Until the sleep schedule from freedom kicked in, and stopped me from loosing my sleep too!

The other schedule starts 00:00 and go to 12 pm. This strict schedule, blocks even search engines.

Just those two things are magical: preserve my sleep, prevent my morning from spiraling.

The third schedule is always active. This one is less strict, but it still prevents me from straing from the path too deeply. Today, I added the apps I accessed yesterday to this list.

By doing this my focus time is more focused. My resting time become more restful. My days becomes more intentional, where I prioritize better and consequently live an overall better life.

author: John000516

title: Freedom: Screen Time Control
content:
I hate the Recurring Mode so much (in locked mode).    If you set this for a future time, it automatically locks you out of all your websites and apps right away.   It doesn‚Äôt even wait for your scheduled time.    This is such a disaster.   

The 24 Hour ALL Day option on locked mode is an even bigger disaster.    This basically runs on a loop.  It doesn‚Äôt even give you an option to schedule days or weeks in advance.   It just does a 24 Hour never-ending loop.   

I also had to call the Help Desk several times this week because the app keeps double booking the same active session.  That means if you have it on Locked mode, you have to waste your one-time a week  cancellation just to get rid of the active session that you posted on accident.   

And even when your recurring session is over, they still have the recurring session actiivated again in the background when it should be cancelled.   

This can easily be fixed by letting us schedule the Locked mode in days instead of just hours on a never-ending loop.   This lets us reset our schedule when  our days are over.  

This app has the potential for 5 stars if you fix all these issues.     I will change my rating to 5 stars if you fix the recurring mode, allow us to set the timer in days, and stop the double booking and stop the recurring mode from running again after it has already ended.
author: Starcraft 1979

title: Freedom: Screen Time Control
content:
Finally. An app that actually improves my life. I went from 5-7 hours of scrolling per day to less than an hour. I allow myself 1 hour of scroll time per day and often times after 15 minutes, I can see how mine numbing it all is and stop early.

There are no workarounds for this app. No ‚Äúignore anyway‚Äù buttons to press. You‚Äôre locked out and truly free.

The amount of time I‚Äôve won back in my life is almost comical. I was a zombie for the longest time. Social media is an illness.

title: Lojong: Meditation & Relax
content: Get this app if your Spanish or Portuguese is serviceable. You will not regret it. Actually, my Portuguese is RUSTY, but I have no trouble following Lojong. I have several meditation apps, including two of the very biggest names. Lojong is by far the very best. A perfect blend of teaching, to give context, and meditation. And it‚Äôs very carefully thought out. The teachings and meditations build on each other. It doesn‚Äôt have the scattershot feeling that seems to be common in meditation apps. Also, I don‚Äôt know which Tibetan teacher or teachers the creators of the app studied with, but their training comes across as deep. Really, using this app feels like belonging to a sangha with a great teacher. I hope the app store features this more prominently in U.S. searches for meditation apps. Even though there is no English version, Spanish is so widely spoken in the U.S. It‚Äôs like this app is a treasure hiding in plain sight.

author: Lola610

title: Brightmind Meditation
content:
Well, you have a large number of high ratings, which encourage me to try Brightmind. So, I tried the intro meditation, explaining to me why we learn mindfulness.
So far, so good. I have, shall we say, experienced meditations of many types, with an emphasis on mindfulness. 
The first problem, and I didn‚Äôt blame your app personally, is the price of membership. I am rated 100% disabled by the VA, due to my time in the armed forces, which means I‚Äôm unable to work. Again, not your fault, but as people you get than me like to say‚Ä¶‚Äù just sayin‚Äô‚Äù.
The other comment that bothered me is the first topic you addressed in your version of FAQs is that you do not use nature sounds in the background of any meditation. Your reasoning is something I cannot agree with.
I guess I‚Äôm one of ‚Äúthose people‚Äù that like nature. Mindfulness, as you correctly described, is training your self to be aware of subtle things , feelings, sounds, sensations, developing the ‚Äú mental muscle‚Äù to improve your cognitive ability to maleate your awareness, basically your life. I was attracted to Brightmind because it claimed to help you ‚Äú find happiness‚Äù. I‚Äôm thinking, He‚Äôll yeah! Who doesn‚Äôt want to be happy?
I wanted you to know that this is meant to be a comment letter, not a hateful flame mail.
I also wish to point out that, because of the high level of work related stress in Japan, they developed a strategy which became a social trend, called‚Äù Forest Bathing‚Äù. Dr Sanjay Gupta, a neurosurgeon who sometimes appears on CNN, Fox, and runs a podcast, while still performing surgeries, went to visit Tokyo, Osaka, and other cities and provinces that I don‚Äôt recall the names. He was researching the area around the ‚ÄúBlue Zones‚Äù, which are areas on the planet where people tend to live past 100 years. Okinawa is on the list along with the Italian islands, and a few others. In Japan, people meet in a park in one of the Northern Perfectures of the main island of Japan. They test their cortisol level with strips of indicator paper, which folks can get in drug stores. They take notes of the reading. Then they take a hike through a heavily forested park in the mountains for 20-30 minutes. They return and retest their cortisol level. It dropped over twenty units( either mg or micrograms, I need to watch the documentary again.) since cortisol is a stress hormone that secretes into the body during chronic stress, it‚Äôs always good to keep it low.
Okay, I am finished, I just wanted to mention that maybe you might consider adding an option for people who like nature sounds. My mental faculties always seem sharper after my wife and I walk in our park. But, I realize there are people who might prefer silence.
I like both and have meditated both ways.
Be well, you do have good information on here and I‚Äôm sorry I couldn‚Äôt join you on the journey. Blessings.

title: Brightmind Meditation
content: I am really enjoying this app! Brightmind has helped me remain consistent with my meditation & being mindful - I set a goal to meditate at least twice per week - I started with a small, realistic goal, however I use this app pretty much daily & look forward to meditating & unlocking the next step on the app. I‚Äôve even got my husband to meditate with me & we‚Äôve made it part of our nightly routine. I‚Äôve noticed I have been sleeping better at night & peacefully drifting off to sleep without the mental chatter that would so often have me tossing & turning at night. author: crillylilly

title: Brightmind Meditation
content:
I have been meditating for 7ish years and have tried Headspace and 10% Happier in addition to Brightmind. I think all three apps are good for people who want to start a meditation practice. 

That said, for me Brightmind is far and away the most helpful because it is a coherent curriculum that provides a structured progression while also giving a wide variety of options. I had hit a plateau with my meditation practice and was on the verge of giving up. Shinzen Young‚Äôs ‚ÄúUnified Mindfulness‚Äù, which is the conceptual framework that underlies the app, provides tools that helped me find concentration, clarity, and equanimity in a far more powerful yet flexible way. 

Other apps, books, and methods seem to repeat the same (to me, stale) advice: ‚Äújust return to your breath‚Äù with a haphazard mixture of voices and guidance saying mostly the exact same thing. 

Brightmind and Unified Mindfulness guided me through a series of very diverse approaches, allowing me to experiment and find a technique that works FAR better for me than watching my breath. I‚Äôm re-energized and committed in a transformed way.

title: Waking Up: Meditation & Wisdom
content: I am thankful for you guidance. I started meditation at 24.  At 56, I was blessed to be introduced to Tibetan Buddhism with my primary teacher being Khechen Thrangu Rinpoche. I stopped meditating and was busy with her care but she worked hard and became fully independent. Her meditation is being fully immersed in gardening.  I had a hard time restarting practice and politics mad me angry with its loss of kindness and compassion.  Your guidance is very helpful and uplifting and I have found the peace that I had for so many years along with great calm. Thank you for your wisdom and guidance. May you be peaceful and at ease; may you be happy; may you be safe.  Bob Haile.

title: Healthy Minds Program
content: That‚Äôs all there is to say, really. It‚Äôs a practical, accessible, research-grounded approach to meditation that is easy to integrate into daily life. It truly teaches you the fundamentals of insight meditation. I did the whole program and now I meditate 30 minutes a day silently, and have introduced the app to tons of my friends and coworkers. I have a completely different relationship to my mind, body, and emotions after this app, and have actually become a practicing Buddhist as a result of feeling so inspired and transformed by these approaches to awareness. Thank you!!!

title: Healthy Minds Program
content:
I‚Äôm deeply grateful to have found Healthy Minds. With every other recommended app out of my budget, I wasn‚Äôt sure how I would go about learning to meditate‚Äîa practice I knew I needed to begin for my mental, spiritual and physical health. The curriculum is perfectly paced for a beginner, it carries a wonderful balance of instruction and practice, and the teachings are data-backed and fulfilling. I am about halfway through and already plan to start over and include my tween and teens in order to introduce mindfulness to them at an earlier age than I‚Äôve discovered it. Thank you to the developers for putting so much thought, research and heart into this app. And thank you for making it accessible.

A note: I wish specific lessons/practices were easier to find after listening the first time. Accessing a catalog of previously listened to sessions would be very helpful in giving myself additional practice and for sharing with others.
author: JZM7568

title: Healthy Minds Program
content:
I‚Äôve been working on my personal mediation practice on and off for years. Recently I was introduced to the book Altered Traits which chronicles the work of the authors in their quest to discover how meditation changes the brain‚Äôs neural connections.

At the end, there was a mention of this app so I decided to give it a try. It is so well structured and presented. Many apps charge a significant monthly fee. They merely ask for a donation if you find it of benefit. 

Most surprising is how these benefits do not require hours in silence. Instead, they teach you how these practices can be done anywhere at anytime. My only recommendation is to commit to following the program. They have spent decades researching what works and how to implement meditation into your life. Why not give it a try? I believe you will find it well worth the minimal time and effort.

author: Matt1990guy

title: TimeFinder: Time Blocking
content:
The beauty of TmeFinder is in its simplicity and ease of use.

UPDATE 11/01/24:  How can the best app keep getting better? I‚Äôm not sure, but it happens with every update!

üìÖ This app allows you to take control of your schedule. Other apps may boast of this, but in my experience, none are as simple or as user-friendly as this one.

üß† What most impresses me about this app is its ability to manage my mind.  (Am I the only one who can relate to that meme about my mind being like an internet browser with 19 tabs open, 3 that are frozen, and no idea where the music is coming from?)

Thanks to TimeFinder, I can make quick work of scheduling my day (I have a list of routines saved for frequent tasks: get ready for work, commute, work, lunch break) while also making sure my To-Do lists get gone. The widget and Apple Watch notifications keep my on track throughout the day.

You know that awful feeling when you‚Äôre trying to go to sleep, but get flooded with a long list of things you need to do?  I even have a specific list dedicated to that. It‚Äôs not in a random place to be forgotten about, but it‚Äôs in TimeFinder where I can easily drag and drop it to my schedule as time allows and then mark it done‚Äî and I don‚Äôt mean figuratively.  A feature within TimeFinder allows you to mark tasks as done from within a list and as you complete it on the schedule. 

One word of caution: Because this app is so intuitive, you may think it a waste of time to view the video tutorial in the settings. You can easily navigate the app and get great benefit from it even if you don‚Äôt, but if you do watch it, you‚Äôll get the scoop on some other great time-saving features that will maximize the overall benefit of the app.

If you really want to save yourself some time, you‚Äôll stop reading reviews and download it to see for yourself!
author: Sra.Zamora

title: TimeFinder: Time Blocking
content:
To begin,  customer support is great! I had trouble getting the app to sync between devices and Luke responded within a few hours that very evening (a Sunday evening at that).

If you have ADD and are tired of feeling guilty for frequently missing deadlines or important tasks due to lack of time because you‚Äôve spiraled down a trail of hyper focusing on (mostly) trivial aspects of some other thing, this app is for you. Segmenting the day into manageable chunks that I can visually see has given me breathing room because I can know that I do have to time to accomplish these things. 

I thought the price seemed a bit steep at first, but having it sync between all devices is worth it, as it is so much easier to keep up with. But, while this is a great tool, it is still just a tool. If you want the relief this can bring, you have to want to make the change, and this app can do this if you put in the effort.

author: lii moe

title: T-Mobile FamilyMode
content:
There are many irritating issues with this app.
Location feature, if it works, (half the time it doesn't), may position your child somewhere off the coast of Africa. In the south Atlantic Sea. 
Despite choosing to stay logged in, I'm constantly being asked to login again. 
It's difficult to determine days that are highlighted and days that aren't when determining schedules. 
Light shade, darker shade of pink? On off??
One of our four kids has an iPhone and he just turns it on and off at his convenience but that's not the apps fault. (and yes there's consequences for that behavior and internal features through the iPhone ((which is free)))
Notifications, when turned on, don't always give notifications. 
Sometimes notifications seem faulty or not accurate. 
I had arranged phone call with T-Mobile to talk about this app and have them walk me through an issue I was having. It's taking several calls to find somebody who knew the app enough to talk about it.
 After setting up an appointment for someone to call me, I was stood up.
Looking forward to my kids getting old enough where I don't need to use this app anymore.  It's at times, when you need relying on it, that it seems to fail. I  ask is this worth the money if it's not accurate. 
And seriously!  I hate having to log in all the time.

author: teague_ro

title: T-Mobile FamilyMode
content:
honestly i hate this. i may be biased as my parents used this to control my screen time and what i do on my phone‚Äî but i feel like there are way better options out there.
 
i‚Äôll start by mentioning i do like a few parts of the app.  there‚Äôs a feature that lets u see ur child‚Äôs location, which may weird me out, but i definitely understand the need for it. i also like how it lets parents monitor their kids screen time, although i personally feel it takes it too far.
first of all, it shows every website and app you use or download to your guardian. this gives you rly little privacy, which is pretty frustrating especially for a child or teenager. in my experience, this feature scared me a lot as well; i was terrified my parents would use it to either belittle me for my interests or force me to get rid of games and such that i enjoyed. it also lets your parents specifically block you from viewing certain things, which prevented me from playing a mobile game made for children 9+ (as i said, i‚Äôm definitely biased, tho i do think i have some valid points!).
this is getting long, so i‚Äôll end off by saying how this app and others like it can ruin the trust between children and parents. again, i‚Äôll be speaking from my experience ‚Äî my parents were always trying to control what i did both online and in person, which led to me having very little trust in them, and them using this app did not benefit that poor relationship. i feel like there are ways to monitor ur children and make sure they don‚Äôt view anything bad or inappropriate online without installing apps such as this.

tldr, although the app works as intended, i would not recommend it to others because it gives ur child little privacy and prevents you from building a trusting relationship w them.

title: T-Mobile FamilyMode
content:
So my parents put this app on my phone to #1. Lower my phone bill and #2. Make me focus on school which I want to do and this app helps me do that tbh. I have severe ADD and honestly this app really helps me not get sucked into games on my phone and makes me not spend all day on my phone either. Really helps with time management. It‚Äôs kinda funny how many young children give bad reviews but if you are a concerned parent I would highly recommend this. Also PARENTS:: if you don‚Äôt want your kid to know every time u check their location or history disable notifications on their phone for this app specificallyüëç

While yes this app is good for your kids and you can see what they‚Äôre doing (which I think is good like it‚Äôs important to keep your kids safe), this app does have some technical issues that are pretty annoying(mostly on the child‚Äôs side). 

The biggest issue I have is that in the morning after bedtime mode has run out, the app will continuously tell me it is still bedtime mode. To fix this I have to turn wifi off, or turn airplane mode on, or both, or turn off my phone and back on again, and then turn airplane mode on and off because IT IS STILL ON BEDTIME MODE WHEN MINE SHOULD BE DONE. I usually spend 3mins OR MORE trying to get my phone to work it is very annoying. As someone who has time management issues it would be super helpful if this was fixed. I once didn‚Äôt get on my phone in the morning because I woke up late and had to time manage, I got in my car and tried to pull up google maps to get to a job but nope. It‚Äôs still bedtime mode even though it wasn‚Äôt üò≠ Devs PLEASE fix this! 
2nd issue I can‚Äôt have this app installed and use the 
United app?? Idk why probably something with the vpn but I dont rlly care. Thank you have a good day!!

author: june29650

title: 1Blocker - Adblock
content:
Update: the element hiding feature doesn‚Äôt seem to block anything anymore. Its implementation has changed. Previously, everything was done in Safari. Now, selecting the 1Blocker addon in Safari redirects to the app itself so that the web page can be loaded in a container. Supposedly, the changes I make are saving, but video ads, banners, and floating elements that follow as you scroll remain unblocked.

I will be canceling my subscription. Why pay for something that doesn‚Äôt work anymore?

Original review: Since updating to version 6.1.1, this app needs to download filters each time the app is opened. This seems to break something, as most of the time the app never loads.  The only fix is to kill the process and relaunch, which may or may not work.  Once it finally does load, it reapplies the same filters to Safari again, even though nothing has changed.

Who decided to code this behavior?

The good news is that filters still work, and most of the garbage on the internet is blocked. Disappointingly, nothing on YouTube gets blocked, so good luck with using that dumpster fire of a web site.

Two stars until recent changes are reverted.  I‚Äôve used 1Blocker for years, but I may need to look elsewhere.

title: Yoga Fit | Yoga for Beginners
content:
I started using his app because I was joining some siblings in a 75 Hard program. I had no idea how to do Yoga. My husband even kind of teased me that yoga wasn‚Äôt a real workout. Then he saw what I was doing.

I started this app at 270 pounds and worried I couldn‚Äôt do any of the exercises because of my weight. But this app offered level 1 yoga that helped me get around some of my limitations and started me slow.  I‚Äôm now on my second round of a 28 day plan.  I had stopped about a month ago because I was struggling to balance so many other areas of my life that waking up at 5 am was becoming too difficult.  But this morning I woke up and started right where I left off. I didn‚Äôt think I would be able to, but the exercises are still simple enough my body remembered and I still felt good, but challenged.

The app is very easy to use. I use it on an older iPad. I don‚Äôt ever have signal issues or glitches that cause the videos to stutter.

I use the very detailed instructions which helps since some poses you can‚Äôt exactly see the screen.

author: dominique.ath

title: everyday - Habit Tracker
content:
I‚Äôve tried a lot of habit trackers, but there is almost always TOO much to fill in that it made me not want to use them. The process of filling everything in felt like it needed to be a habit in itself. 

My ADHD brain gets too distracted; I desperately wanted simplicity. After years, I‚Äôve developed some great habits simply by using timers and reading Atomic Habits, which this app draws some concepts from. Now, I want to visualize this in a simple, easy-understand-visual for novice data folks like my wife or friends. So I turned to this app, (shout out r/dataisbeautiful). This app does just that. With intention and time, I‚Äôm excited to see what my visual will look like. Literally 3 click options:

-Did you do it? Tap.
-Did you do some of it? Tap.  Tap.
-Didn‚Äôt do it? Tap. Tap. Tap.

Obviously, there are things to fill out. But compared to others, IMO, set up is simple. Reminder options are available. There is even an option for breaking habits! 

Free to use, so I‚Äôve testing with 3 habits and I‚Äôm very happy so far. It‚Äôs only 1/2, but so far, so good. 

Some improvements for this app, for me, would just be customizable user preferences. Specifically, visuals with fonts. I have unique reading needs so the ability to alter these helps a ton! This would help keep the app accessible for all. TY for your great app.

title: Ad Remover - Ad Blocker
content:
Super nice, and successful. I‚Äôm honestly such a big fan of this app. I wouldn‚Äôt use any other app at all, ever again. This is the holy grail of ad blockers. Seriously if you‚Äôre considering it, get the app. It‚Äôs well worth it. Everything works super well and clearly, barely and ads for me in the actual app. I am in love! I should have gotten this way sooner than I actually did. This is a life saver for me and everyone in my family! I‚Äôve sent this to just about everyone I know and they all love it. Ad blockers are one of the best ways to help secure your privacy online, reduce clutter on websites, and avoid spyware-infected ads. Although it's certainly possible to find a paid ad blocking software, there's no reason to spend money on one. Most of the best ad blockers are completely free to use and this is one of them! This app is good for blocking DNS requests from a large list of servers that are involved with malware, spyware, adware, and tracking. This means that you can‚Äôt interact with a dangerous websites unless you manually change your settings to give it access.
One of the things that makes this feature special is that it can protect you even if you are already infected by malware. It blocks communications from dangerous servers, which stops malware from following through with dangerous activities. The best apps help you get more out of your smartphone or tablet purchase. They are the lifeblood of your iOS or Android devices that provide fun when you're bored, function when you have stuff to do, and have the potential to change how you use your tech.

This is a sponsored review.

author: Alandaledaniel

title: Ad Remover - Ad Blocker
content:
This app blocks every ad while you're in Safari. While it doesn't block in-app ads nearly as much, I've noticed it definitely cuts down on the quantity of those ads as well, so maybe that's a beneficial side effect even though it's not supposed to. If you watch YouTube in Safari, you won't get anymore of those pesky ads prior to your video. The app is simple to use, and has a pleasing user interface. The only thing that isn't very appealing is the lack of dark mode in the app, but that could be added in the future. Otherwise, the app is very nice to look at and is extremely simple to use to. Just tap one button and all of your Safari ads will be gone. If you've ever used an ad blocker on your desktop computer, you know how useful those can be, and this app works just as well. If you have a limited data plan, this helps filter out unnecessary junk ads that only waste your data by showing you information and offers you don't care about. It's also a necessity for privacy as well. Ads track everything you do on the internet, and the only way to get around that is with a quality ad blocker that stops those ad providers from seeing what you're watching or what items you've been looking at online. If you're Internet connection is slow and usually requires a long time to load up everyday pages, this ad blocker will help as it will get rid of content that just slows down your internet speeds. This app is a necessity for anyone who uses the internet, and it will make your browsing experience significantly more fluid.

author: javenlp

title: Ad Remover - Ad Blocker
content:
This ad blocker is great. It works quietly in the background with an intricate level of security. Gone are all the pop ups and pesky advertising.  Those auto play videos are halted too.  In addition to blocking ads this is equipped with many other features such as privacy protection.  The frustration and headache is eliminated now, and I can search the web and work in peace.   I especially like running this as I stream videos. Some streaming outlets normally run ads about every 10 minutes into a video.  This app successfully shuts that nonsense off.  

A couple of things I have also noticed with Ad remover is my Page load time has improved. It also appears that my bandwidth usage has been reduced.  Ads are no longer eating up RAMs.   A lot of times I would accidentally click on ads and be sent to a new page. That stops here so my user experience on the net has improved immensely.   This app also cuts out unnecessary exposure to malware attacks.  

One of the neat things I‚Äôve noticed about iOS 13 using Safari is that the browser app can process the list of what to block before the page even loads. The result? Much faster page load times iOS 13 users who've downloaded this app.

As long as you keep this app running you will continue blocking ads, tracking codes, and other third-party scripts that benefits users by increasing page load times, improving battery life, and protecting privacy. Not to mention, you know it‚Äôs eliminating the annoyance of interruptive ads.

All in all, I must say these developers have done a great job covering all the bases and this is a solid app.

content:
To begin, Ad blockers in general are one of the best ways to help secure your privacy online, reduce clutter on websites, and avoid spyware-infected ads. Although it‚Äôs certainly possible to find a paid ad blocking software, there‚Äôs no reason to spend money on one. Most of the best ad blockers are completely free to use. With that said, this Ad is the BEST! It‚Äôs 14 day free-trial is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Such a simple concept. Not only are there multiple types of advertisements you might run into, there are multiple ways to block advertisements. Ultimately, how an ad-blocker goes about blocking ads does not matter so much as long as it doesn‚Äôt impede your ability to effectively browse the web and doesn‚Äôt invade your privacy. Additionally, a good ad blocker will block most types of ads. This app here is no different! I am extremely satisfied with this service because I can finally surf the internet without the annoying pop-up ads! I‚Äôd 100% recommend installing this app!! This application does exactly what it implies... it blocks ads! Pretty much all of them! Banner ads? Yes! Those annoying Flash ads that seem to be popping up everywhere? You hey! Facebook ads, Google ads, pop-up ads? Check, check, and check! Using this application basically results in the practical advantage of faster page loads, which pleasantly surprised me! This app is also pretty straight forward. Install it, run the application, go about your internet browsing, and ads will seem as if they are a thing of the past. To conclude, this app, for me (and for you too) is very effective and beneficial, easy to use, and I highly recommend anyone seeking a smoother, less cluttered Web-Browsing experience! You‚Äôre welcome!!

This is a sponsored Review
author: Asha Dimoji

title: Serenity: Guided Meditation
content: I‚Äôve tried so many meditation apps and this is the first I feel like I can stick with. I love the simplicity of the app. It‚Äôs very straightforward with a clean UI. With other apps I felt overwhelmed by the amount of content or the way it was organized in the app to get to the content I was interested in. Because I‚Äôm new at meditation I really like that the guided mediations are helpful and also 10 min. Any more than 10 and I‚Äôd be too overwhelmed to try. They also offer mini mediations that are less than 5 min. I also love that they give you actual free content that‚Äôs useful. And for those of you who are tired of paying a subscription you‚Äôll love (like i do) that you can choose to unlock everything with a one time payment. In the end I actually chose the very reasonably priced 6 month subscription to try out more of the sleep sections and stress relief sections. But if I stick with it I will definitely upgrade to the one time payment. This app made it easy for me to want to support by upgrading. Keep up the good work!

title: Flow - Focus & Pomodoro Timer

The other thing, and this is more of an add on, but it would be nice to have a small list or a way to name the current flow to the task you‚Äôre working on. That way it keeps that task at hand and in mind. I would use the ‚Äúshow session title in the menu bar icon‚Äù setting if I could in face customize the session title to something relevant that I‚Äôm doing.

author: TrumpVSJoe

title: Portal - Escape Into Nature
content:
I really love this app; I'm a studen in University and I can now be taken back to a class I was studying for by hearing one of these soundscapes, which is a really interesting experience to say the least. What I really use Portal for, however, is to sleep. 
After listening to a podcast about the Amazon rainforest, I now go to sleep listening to "Twilight rainforest" in St. Lucia. 
When I read fiction, I always put on that "Spring Barley Field" and it takes me straight into fairytale land. 
When I want white noise like sound for sleep or focus, why not do it in beautiful "Ama Dablam" in Nepal, or my all time favorite "Highlands Snow" in Scotland (seriously this one is just perfect).
I've woken up to "Fingle Woods" birds chirping so much that I once was kind of confused where I was when I woke up.
And then, there's Stuart Chan at Portal, who's the goat. They hooked me up with the beta for Mac so I could try it early and "help out" by using it and find bugs (little do they know they were the ones helping me hehe). Speaking of, any bugs I did find Stuart instantly responded to and it was fixed so quickly.

Yes, it's expensive, and I'll be sad when my year subscription ends come november - because I'm in my final year of university and I need all the spare change I can get. But as soon as I'm able, I plan on putting my money where my mouth is, and I suggest you do too (on your mouth that is, I don't want your money on my mouth).

Here's to portals to better worlds; or has it been our beautiful world all along?

author: SJM14huh?

title: Portal - Escape Into Nature
content:
Portal is that rare app that's worthy of your time and attention because that's precicely what it gives you in return‚Äîtime and attention. It's. so. zen.

I've used Portal on my iPhone for a couple of years, projecting it to my Homepod for pleasant morning birdsong and water lapping on the shores of Lake Bled, or Triglav thunderstorms for a soothing night's sleep; I've even taken the birds of Fingle Woods with me on my walks while I simultaneously listen to a podcast or audiobook.

But the desktop app brings a whole new dimension to the experience. I'm mesmerized by the beauty of the video taking over my desktop background in its gentle, near-seamless loop. It's a window into the outside world‚Äîany outside world that you want right now. Is it a river? A waterfall? A beach? A field? A rainy forest? Portal has brought my mind to a whole new place of focus and productivity I hadn't felt for some time. I adore it. This is a uniquely poignant and important productivity tool, the true missing piece in the remote worker's arsenal. You might try mixing it with music, too‚ÄîI always love a good afternoon Lo-Fi listen‚Äîand see where your focus takes you.

I've been in contact with the team behind Portal, and they're a pleasure to talk with. They take feedback sincerely and their craft seriously. I can't wait to see what they bring to Portal next!

title: Portal - Escape Into Nature

I enthusiastically read through all the notes in each update hoping to see those magic words: ‚ÄúApple TV‚Äú. Yea, I am very antsy for this feature, but would rather have the team take their time and get it right than to rush something out that‚Äôs not ready for release.

author: Typocaa

title: Portal - Escape Into Nature
content: I don‚Äôt write reviews for things, but needed to share that this app is my favorite of all the apps I use.  It is an essential part of my life now and should be hardcoded into my phone.  I splurged on AirPods Max this year just for this app.  I listen to different portals to go to sleep at night and when I have a tough project requiring focus or when I need extra help with migraine relief.  This app and the various scenes are amazing in sound and visual quality.  I like the increasing variety presented (I love the storms, fireside, and forest sounds the most, though the lava ones are a surprising new favorite), and look forward to more places and soundscapes and app versions in the future (Yule log?  Seasonal forests?  Night sounds/summer crickets?  App for AppleTV?)  Thanks to the developers for providing a beautiful and natural experience with almost no music, and for the little extras like the gentle alarms built into the timers that transition you from a focus/relaxation episode kindly.  I highly recommend the app to everyone.

title: YPT - Study Group
content:
I‚Äôve tried probably 90% of the time management, pomodoro, calendar, todolist apps, all of them end up kinda annoying or not that useful and limiting. The best stable really good app is forest for pomodoro sessions, it‚Äôs really good , stable updates, simple UI but kinda limited ( No group , no chats, u have to share the code every session, no calendar , no simple todolist ‚Ä¶.etc) although their stats page very clean , easy to understand quickly if ur preforming good or bad. A few weeks ago a student invited me to this app, it‚Äôs so good it solved all of the issues I had with the other apps , but here is some point to improve it: 

 1. Unlimited Group members , why is only 50 members, I got like 300 students in my class , how would compete with all of them. At least make it like 200 or 300 members. 

 2. Glitches, why when I open the app it takes like 2 or 3 seconds to open the home page. Idk is it an animation thing or something else but whenever u stop the timer or change some settings, it takes like a sec to get action done. I don‚Äôt mind it that much but this could make a lot of iPhone users Not happy with experience. 

3. plz add the option to set ur own time study start, why is always start at 5am . I start at 1 am so plz give us the option.

 4.there are more functionality and design point to add but I really think it‚Äôs much more important to focus on much smoother experience.
